title: Fire Island National Seashore: NPS Centennial
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial             NPS Centennial       The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016. As we lead up to the centennial, we invite you to participate in Find Your Park Experiences to learn, discover, be inspired, or simply have fun in national parks. Find Your Park Experiences offer unique opportunities to explore national parks both in person and online. Check out the experiences in this park or search all experiences to identify an opportunity that matches your interests. You can also share your national park story at FindYourPark.com. A Call to Action remains the foundation for our 2016 centennial preparations. It is the National Park Service's blueprint for the future, outlining the innovative work we want to accomplish. Fire Island National Seashore is a big part of this effort. Take a look at what we're doing and get involved!   Experiences      Top of the Morning from the Top of the Tower  Climb 192 steps to the top of the tower and watch as the sun climbs above the horizon. Get a bird's-eye view of the wild Atlantic, the beautiful barrier beach and Great South Bay, and the South Shore of Long Island. Take photos or just take it all in. Read more      Call to Action Projects      Fire Island Shares Park Science at 10th Biennial Science Conference   Read more   Fire Island National Seashore Responds to Non-Native Forest Pest  The National Park Service implemented suppression efforts in 2015 and 2016 to protect maritime forests throughout Fire Island National Seashore from infestations of the southern pine beetle, a non-native forest pest. Read more   New York Public Lands Partner to Help Fourth Graders Find Their Park  The April Conservationist for Kids magazine will help fourth graders find their park in New York State's national parks and heritage areas, wildlife refuges, and state parks.  Read more   Fire Island National Seashore Collaborates with Communities for Spring Clean-Up  More than 70 volunteers gathered for a community clean-up and cleared over 10,000 pounds of debris from Fire Island National Seashore. Read more   Fire Island Shares New Bat Education Resources at Teacher's Open House  Fire Island National Seashore's Student Conservation Association (SCA) Bat Survey Intern helped share new Project EduBat education resources and insight into her work assisting researchers at the Seashore's October Educator Open House. Read more   A Call to Action Projects for Fire Island National Seashore      Centennial Challenges Share your Fire Island Photos #100FireIslandPhotos In honor of the National Park Service Centennial we challenge you to take - and share - Fire Island photos on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. Be sure to tag @FireIslandNPS and use #100FireIslandPhotos to be featured on Fire Island National Seashore's feed. Hike 20.16 Miles Join the Centennial celebration by hiking 20.16 miles in 2016. Participate in at least one park ranger- or partner-led walk and clock the rest of your mileage on your own or on additional Seashore programs. Log sheets to track your mileage are available at Seashore visitor centers and by emailing e-mail us. Upon completion of the challenge earn a free "Find Your Park" Centennial pin. Pick It Up!  Join a "Pick It Up" beach cleanup in March, April, or May and help clear 2,016 pounds of marine debris from Fire Island National Seashore beaches. Beach cleanup details are available on the Calendar of Events.
